result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Roatch Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Case No. 05CF64.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with Michelle J. or her children.
Must have no contact with Paige N.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Steven J Roatch in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Defendant Steven J Roatch in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:42 Case called.  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are Dismissed and Read In.  Argument by State.  Argument by Attorney Yonko.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

Total length of sentence 4 years 0 months
Initial Confinement 1 year 0 months - 0 days credit
Extended Supervision 3 years 0 months
Concurrent with Case No. 05CF64
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Not eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Conditions:

Must have no contact with Paige N.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
Must comply with AODA plan
Court costs

Defendant Steven J Roatch in court with attorney Richard L. Yonko.  Defendant Steven J Roatch in custody.  Angela L. Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives formal reading and enters NG pleas.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Steven J Roatch in court with attorney Richard L Yonko who appears by phone.  Defendant Steven J Roatch in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense's request for furlough to attend visitation and funeral of father. State does not object. Court orders Defendant be released by 3:00 p.m. tomorrow and to report back by 8:00 p.m. tomorrow night. If he complies with bond conditions while out, he will also be released Thursday at 11:00 a.m. and is to report back to jail by 4:00 p.m. Thursday.
